comment.author: 22056898@N07
comment._content: Mrs. L. R. Guggenheim is most likely Leonie (Bernheim) Guggenheim (1865-1959), wife of Murry Guggenheim or less likely, her daughter, Lucille Guggenheim (1894-1973). The Guggenheim family are relatives of mine and those are the only two Guggenheim women who's names start with "L" during that time period, unless it's someone from a different Guggenheim family.

comment.author: 22056898@N07
comment._content: I think G.T. Kirby is Gustavus Town Kirby, President of the Amateur Athletic Union and president of the American Olympic Committee for the 1912 Stockholm Olympics.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
trancell:

Thanks for the information. It seems fair to say this is Gustavus Town Kirby on the far left. In the course of verifying the information, it seems the gentleman on the right is Charles B. Stover, Parks Commissioner of NYC at the time, so we'll add that as well.
